Posts.Content: On Jul 30, 2015 12:29 AM Possibilities wrote: I had many yearly mammograms, all negative.  I had been able to feel a lump in my breast for years but the doctors were convinced it must be a fibroid cyst.  Eventually my breast started itching like crazy, right where I'd always felt the lump but another mammogram was negative.  Then my skin began to pucker and there was no denying it anymore.  Mammogram still didn't really show anything, ultrasound was a "maybe", but MRI and biopsy confirmed breast cancer.  They referred to it as "ghost cancer."  Four years after a lumpectomy, radiation, drugs and yearly negative mammograms, it has now metastasized to my bones--ribs, pelvis, spine and femurs.  (Completely found by accident when I went to the hospital for another reason.) I think we've been trained to rely on mammograms to tell us whether or not we have cancer.  I now always advise people to trust their bodies, pay attention to what's happening, and insist on more tests if something doesn't feel right.Hi How are things since they have found in your spine and pelvis? Have they been able to treat it with effect? My mum has just found out she has breast cancer after the mammogram showed clear 2 years ago. After tests its too late to operate apparently and its been undetected for so long its now spread to her spine and pelvis. They claim its not curable but treatable with medication. We don't really know much more until Thursday when she sees oncologist. Thanks
Posts.Title: Anyone diagnosed with cancer after negative mammo and ultrasound?

Posts.Content: On Apr 16, 2015 12:55 PM seekingresults wrote: On Jun 13, 2013 1:33 AM SpringFlowers wrote: Suebo, Yes, there are many alternative sites, and many are to be very wary of.  I didn't just dive in without indepth study and many questions, just as you.   I think it's best to look for cures for your 'cancer specific" type...brain, breast, etc.  As well as with me, breast cancer--DCIS.  I know that inflammatory breast cancer and Triple Negative are really beastly and need a very strict regimine.  Looking back on what i've done, don't think I had such a bumpy road.  I figured since 5 oncologists had already told me to "prepare" with at most 18 months, I had nothing to lose.  Here it is 36 months later and all tumor markers are normal, two under the normal, all bloodwork, stats perfect, no fatigue, no pain and if I don't think about that beast, hardly know I've been bitten.  I'm certainly not bragging, I am just thankful God has smiled on me and allowed me to find the right road to travel.  Cancer is nothing to be "bravado" about, it is a disgusting, low life beast that robs not only the sufferer, but destroys friendships and family ties in many instances.  I have been lucky that I have good family that has hauled me up on those miserasble days.  My daughter was with me from time I was DX'd, never fails to call.  My son as well, and my dear daughter in law.  I have the best husband I could ever hope for, so considerate and caring....I feel awful for him.  This is our second marriage, he lost his first wife from breast cancer; she was only 34, leaving him with 2 small boys....and not a clue where to pick up, but we put a wonderful family together with my two and his two, then again the scum beast reared it's ugly head and took our son at 42 with lung cancer, such a dear young man in his prime with so much to live for...so, I am not frivilous in my thinking.   I do know from all the books i've read that cancer is indeed Anaerobic, and only a good diet can combat that particular illness, so immediately I went on strict diet and have kept my body alkaline.  It was a bit hard at first, but now just seems natural.  I can only tell you what i've done, be wary of those clinic's in Mexico, they will bleed you dry and you can do the same thing at home for a few hundred dollars where they will charge you upwards of $50,000 - yes, Fifty Thousand, plus, plus, plus.  I know people who have gone and they are no better off.  Just do the simple things i've done, they work just as well.  I can send you a copy of my scan report and tumor markers/bloodwork.  I do not lie about such a serious condition.  First, start with the Jim Kelmum Protocol...google it.  That got all the cancer out of my soft tissue, lungs, liver, etc.    If you want me to send you list of nutrients, will be very happy to do so.  Very simple, and as I mentioned, very inexpensive.  I may have spent around $80.00 to get started, then just replenish as needed.   If you've heard of IPT therapy, such as the Linchitz Clinic in NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com     Jim Kelmun Protocol is much the same, only dirt cheap, but it works.  If you've had any chemistry, even high school, remember how baking soda activates in liquid and creates oxygen...does the same in your body.  Cancer cells are killed by oxygen.   Just let me know if you want the entire "what I did" will be glad to email to you....no, money not involved, just a bit wordy and don't want to take up so much room on here, also, you'd be surprised how hostile people are when you say alternative, yet I don't see any great cures with chemo.   Nor did my friend who was Dx'd same week as me.  She went the whole way, mastectomy/Lymph node removal, chemo, radiation, reconstruction, then death.   She was only Stage 3 when Dx'd, I was Stage 4.  She passed a year later, i'm still here.  I take NO joy in that, but I do know doc's are painting everyone with the same brush from the same paint can knowing it doesn't work.  I opted for LaserSurgery to have my tumor and all the smaller tumors and splatters as well as only 5 lymph nodes removed and I know that was the saving grace.  Without what I call the Mother Ship spewing cancer cells into the body, seems easy to understand why i've had such good results.   Anyone can, i'm no genuis, but I love myself enough to want to know, learn and then do all I can to enjoy my family and friends as long as possible.  I know Christ is my goal, but I think He put a brain in our head to use at times like these, and i've sure been thru the lessons.    Just let me know if you want a list of the nutrients and what I did, very simple, easy and for me, very effective.   Blessings. Hi Springflowers Hope you are doing well. It was so nice to read your story about how your cancer has been cleared. My mother unfortunately has advanced breast cancer to bladder, around bowel, in lining of lung, in stomach lining and spine. She is doing it quite tough at the moment and has been in hospital most of this year. She had strong chemo about one month ago and it has left her bed ridden and in a poor state. You mentioned being able to email a list of supplements/nutrients you took. I would love to find out exactly what you did as I would like to replicate this for my mum. I also read in an earlier post you said your voice went away for a while but came back. My mothers' voice is very weak at the moment also and she is having laboured breathing. I suspect from the cancer in the lining of her lung. Do you know why your voice went away? If you are still on this website please let me know so we can make email contact.  Many thanks and best regards and hope to hear from you soonHi My mum has just been diagnosed with breast cancer and secondary spine and pelvis cancer. I am really keen to learn what you did using the alternative route please. Please could you inbox me the details if it no trouble for you? Many thanks ??
Posts.Title: how long does a person survive once cancer has spread into different parts of the body
